title: Favorite spot for fall pictures
description: If you are a fan of shooting pictures of the changing colors in Colorado, one of our favorite spots is Squaw Pass. It can also be a romantic spot to have a picnic.
body:
If you are a fan of shooting pictures of the changing colors in Colorado, one of our favorite spots is Squaw Pass. It can also be a romantic spot to have a picnic. 

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d20659.743588589852!2d-105.46161976872267!3d39.67020097444847!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x876ba187a4c66ea3%3A0xf67e8502709b942e!2s25124+Squaw+Pass+Rd%2C+Evergreen%2C+CO+80439!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sus!4v1485406018923" width="600" height="450" frameborder="0" style="border:0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

It isn't to far of a drive from Denver and is totally accessible for any car/motorcycle. We have went there a few times before and every time the views have been breath taking. Depending on when you come out there is a high probability you will see people shooting family/wedding photos. 

![Pretty pictures of the aspen trees changing colors](/content/images/2017/01/SquawPass1.jpg)

There is a really pretty meadow at the very top where you park. There is also a walking path that takes you down through the yellow trees across a small brook to Upper Beaver Brook Reservoir.

![Walking path down to the little creek](/content/images/2017/01/SquawPass2.jpg)

If you are interested in a larger hike you can always head over to [Elk Meadows](http://jeffco.us/open-space/parks/elk-meadow-park/).
author: Tyler
